title: Crispy Chegodilu /Rice flour rings
content:
Ingredients: Rice flour - 1 cup Moong Dal - 1 tb sp Jeera/Cumin seeds - 1 teaspoon Sesame seeds - 1 teaspoon Red chilli powder - 1 tb sp Asafoetida/Inguva - 1/4 teaspoon Salt - 1/2 tb sp Water - 2 cups Oil - to deep fry Procedure:
  • Soak moong Dal in water. Keep aside
  • Boil 2 cups of water in frying pan or medium sized bowl with one tb sp oil
  • Mix rice flour,sesame seeds, cumin/Jeera , red chilly powder,asafoetida and salt in a big bowl
  • Add mixed rice flour in boiling water. Mix them in low to medium heat
  • Transfer this to another bowl
  • Add soaked moong Dal and mix
  • Let it become cool
  • Knead well and make perfect dough
  • On chopping board or clear granite take some dough and roll thin by using both hands
  • cut it equally about 3 inches
  • Make a round shape by attaching edges
  • Deep fry in oil on low to medium heat up to 5 to 7 mins
  • When you cook slowly rice flour rings become crisp and crunchy
  • Repeat the same process till dough completes
  • Serve it in a bowl as evening snack/ pack for kids with lunch box üòÄ‚ò∫Ô∏è
